result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. (Defendant is serving a prison sentence (13cf5463)
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO 13CF5463, and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Eugene Deramus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Post Conviction Relief, recieved and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion for an order clarifying the mechanics of satisfying restitution.
Original transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING  commencing APRIL 23, 2015 received and filed. (47 Pages.)

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 180 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT TO 13CF5463, and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. (Defendant is serving a prison sentence (13cf5463)

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  aw
Sentencing Hearing on Thursday, April 23, 2015 at 8:30 AM in Br 3, SB Rm 316 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defendant has just entered a plea on a pending case today, and court will adjourn both cases for sentencing.  Case adjoruned for sentencing on 4/23/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense filed a motion to adjourned.  Court approves motion. 
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 3.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/5/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wants to enter a plea.  No spins available.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10/28/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
Letter from attorney Novack, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel requests this matter be adjourned until the defendant's other pending case (13CF5463) is resolved. Court denies request for reasons stated on the record. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. State withdraws offer. State will do OTP. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/27/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 3.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 633

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defendant may want to resolve this case, after his burglary trial. Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6-27-2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds there is no basis to have a hearing to dismiss based on prosecutorial vindictiveness, for reasons stated on the record.  Court denies motion.  Defense counsel has no other motions to be filed.  Case set for trial.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6/26/2014 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 10/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregg H Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for status conference on 6/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's brief in response to the defendant's motion to dismiss based on prosecutorial vindictiveness, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 4/21/2014.  Defense to file a response or a letter that he will not be responding by 4/28/2014.  Case adjourned for status on 5/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion to dismiss based on prosecutorial vindictiveness, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has not received an offer yet.  Defense requests more time to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED to $250 CASH.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  William Levins for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #04CF2887 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Michael Flannery-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
